Topic: Draw animals in their habitats with labels
Evidence Statements: The student can draw and label different plants and animals, including humans, in their natural habitats.
The student can depict and label the essential resources each plant and animal needs, such as water, air, or food.
The student can illustrate and label the specific places where plants and animals live (e.g., forests, fields, water bodies).
The student can show and explain the relationship between animals/plants and their habitats (e.g., fish in water, deer in forests with leaves).
The student can demonstrate how plants and animals rely on these habitats and the resources available to meet their needs.
The student can show that each drawing element (plants, animals, and their resources) is part of a system where parts work together to support living things.
